name: Hollywood Casino Hotel & Raceway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been planning on staying at this hotel for some time. Since we usually travel with young kids and the fact that this hotel lacks a pool and/or lacks "kid friendly" activities was a reason we booked elsewhere in the past. Finally, we get a weekend away without the kids so we made our reservations. After some shopping in the area, we decided to spend the evening onsite, taking in the casino and the "Epic" buffet dinning room. The enclosed parking garage would be a positive amenity especially for those snowy/rainy days not to mention it is free. One thing about this property has going for it is that it is clean and the onsite casino is great selling feature for those looking to challenge the House for the jackpot. The bed was very comfortable with no issues. But outside of this, I can not say that we will run back to the hotel. In my opinion, for Bangor, it is overpriced. I can only assume that since we made our booking with an online wholesaler thus the reason for assigning us an ADA/Americans With Disabilities Act room (save the better rooms for the rack rate payers?) because we checked-in well before the majority of rooms would have been even assigned. Since it was an ADA room, the room was overly spacious and the bathroom lost some of the appeal found in other rooms since the counter space was reduced and the walls were covered with handles and an addition shower sprayer. Several deficiencies that we noticed: a lack of water pressure (I've stayed at many high rise hotels and this should not be an excuse) and limited control of A/C or fresh air. I was not impressed that check-in actually pre-charges $50 on your credit card “in case of incidentals” and then say that it may take up to 5 days for the refund to appear on your card. How about this? Charge me when I actually have incidentals!? The onsite buffet restaurant, just off the casino floor, was ok but for $17 per person, we expected more. The service was wonderful it was just that the food lacked variety and different flavors and we left with the impression that much of the food was pre-cooked. I think it is wonderful that Bangor has such a neat hotel (casino, downtown, adjacent to the Center), I just find that the price is set to high for the market leaving one to expect more than what they would typically get for a hotel found on the Odlin Road. Hollywood Slots Hotel is great spot to enjoy an onsite casino but if you’re looking for value and you’re not interested in gambling, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Win with Clean & Comfort; Loss on Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel.Everything you need in one spot.Close to shopping and sightseeing.We found we didn't have to leave the Hotel.The Buffet spread was superb with a great selection of food.The staff was very friendly and made you feel at home.Rooms were clea and,spacious with high end furnature.As an added Bonus we went to the Casino and played the slots.Parking garage was great as well with entrance to Hotel.All in all we were very pleased with this Hotel.We have had the pleasure of staying here on 2 occassions and would definately stay here whenever possible.
reviews.title: Hotel with Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise. Clean spacious and very close to everything. Staff was very helpful but Casino still is in it's growing stage so do not expect too much. Only self parking no Casino promotions for hotel guests but no smoking is great.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Bangor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hollywood Slots Hotel and Casino has been a great experience for my wife and I, Starting with the ease of booking direct with a Hotel Agent, and then the friendly reception when we arrived, including free Undercover Parking, The Rooms are Excellent, and we had a view of the River. After Checking in - we went through the Lobby and Prominade to the Casino - this is a walk through Memory Lane - all the Old Movie Stars are pictured along the way. Besides the Bright and Cheery Casino - you Enter the Epic Buffet - this is truly EPIC, as they have dishes for every appetite, which is completed with a " How can I choose - Desert Section ". Naturally Paul Bunion stands guard across the street, and being from Canada, we were pleasently surprised to find " Tim Hortons " within walking distance. We had a very quiet and peasefull vacation and will definately return.
reviews.title: Escape to Hollywood in Bangor, Maine, USA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I make an effort to travel to Bangor every few months and every time we stay at the Hollywood Slots Hotel. The hotel is very clean and has everything that we need. The staff is always very accomodating. At one particular stay I got the flu and was unable to travel back home to Canada and the staff gave us another 2 nights stay for a very cheap rate which allowed me to get better to be able to travel back home. The food is wonderful at the Epic Buffet and the Casino is very fun. All around it is the perfect trip everytime!!
reviews.title: Home away from home!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We live locally to Hollywood slots, but wanted to spend a night out without our kids and decided to stay here. This is by far the nicest hotel in the area. The staff is excellent, and if for any reason you are not satisfied, management makes it right! Hotel is located right downtown and includes the slots, a large buffet (well priced-breakfast and dinner) and snack court along with some great live bands. Hotel is beautiful, parking is in a garage. Located right downtown, there are several shops, stores, restaurants and bars within walking distance. Rooms are big and beautiful. Location is perfect because Bangor is fairly small and easy to get around. Hotel is right off from the highway.
reviews.title: Prefect Hotel, best in the area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We so enjoyed our trip to Hollywood Slots Hotel and Raceway. The friendly staff made us feel at home. The rooms were beautifully decorated and so clean as was all the facility. The food was delicious and the service exemplary. We enjoyed ourselves on the gaming floor and also just looking at at all the beautiful photos, lining the main corridors, of the Hollywood greats. Everything seemed so well organized and ran as smooth as silk. Can't wait for or next visit.
reviews.title: Great fun, fabulous service, beautiful surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My 20 yr old daughter & I went for a shopping weekend and really were impressed with this new hotel in Bangor. The rooms & hotel were very nice, 4 plus star..however we noticed some people staying there were hmm how do I put this nicely... Let's just say that I do NOT recommend this hotel for famalies, or traveling with children. We felt the casino brought in some nice people, mostly older but also some very drunk, very unrulely & untrustworthy people.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel..but the Casino brings in a diverse crowd!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first night was a good nights sleep, but our second was interrupted by BANGING on the door..some drunks thought our room was their friends..when they realized they had the wrong room they began banging on the friends door for over 30 minutes..VERY LOUDLY!! Apparently their friend has passed out cold. Did I mention this was 3 am.. this went on and on and on for hours.. they were too drunk to know enuf to take a key and their friend kept passing out. When mentioned at the front desk they didn't seem to care............
reviews.title: The Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've stayed here a couple times on business. The rooms are very modern, clean and close to town. Flat screen TVs, big comfortable beds and very nice bathrooms. The free covered parking in the winter is key, as you won't have to clean your car in the morning. Having the casino on site is key. The free breakfast in the morning is adequate. All in all, nicest place to stay in Bangor, hands down. Would stay there again!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Bangor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I love to travel and getaway together and we have found just the place, right in our own backyard. At Hollywood Slots Hotel and Raceway in Bangor,Maine (about a 2 hour drive from our home here in Maine). You actually feel like your on a vacation. When we travel to places like the Caribbean we enjoy gambling, but having this wonderful facility so close to home is absolutely enjoying. The hospitallity is 1st class without a doubt. Talk about clean, you have it here, and I'm a clean freak( I don't mind saying so ).The rooms are very nicely decorated and comfortable. The bathrooms in the rooms are gorgeous, you would have to see it to believe what I'm saying, again 1st class. No 20" T.V. here we are talking 46" if not bigger flat screen to the wall with HD.
reviews.title: What A Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our second visit to Hollywood Slots first time spending the night. I found the girls at the reception desk very unpleasant. We had to ask the girl where we park and how to get to our room she was very short with us. We left not knowing where to park and had to figure out on our own how to get to our room from the parking garage. As far as the rooms they were clean and very nice. The buffet breakfast was very good. \spent some time in the casino the evening we stayed it was very entertaining. Would definatly would stay again just hope the reception would be a little more pleasant.
reviews.title: Favorite in Bangor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I got an offer for a free room from Hollywood Casino in Bangor. My husband and I decided to take my Aunt for a evening away and to have a little fun. We got to the hotel a little early on May 7, 2012 and the front desk clerk was very nice and checked us right in. Room 517. The room we had was a double queen room. When we got to the room it was very clean and had a flat screen tv on the wall, a desk and chair, another chair with ottoman, the 2 night stands and a bureau under the tv. There was also a little closet next to the bathroom with a safe, and ironing board inside. After we got settled in we went downstairs to play some slots. Overall the slots were a little tight but not too bad and we had a fun time with them. At 5pm I had a coupon for buy 1 get 1 free of the buffet so we decided to eat there. I will not do that again. The food had been sitting out for quite some time and was dried out. My husband tried a piece of their pizza and it was so hard he couldn't even bite into it. They really need to make sure they turn the food around better there. For $17 a person, it wasn't worth it in my opinion. We did most of our eating at the Take 2 snack bar. The food there was very good and very reasonably priced. The staff at the hotel and in the casino was very nice and very courteous. My husband had broken his glasses at a slot machine and can't see without them and a slot attendant came to his aid and looked up my players card to find me in the casino. Once she found me she brought to him to help him fix his glasses. Always a good thing to play with your players card! Not only for the perks, but just in case something like this happens and your spouse or significant other is in a totally different area of the casino! Overall we had a great stay and very fun time! I would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.text: I would recommend this place to anyone that stays in Bangor. By far the best hotel in the Bangor area. The rooms are always nice and clean. The bed's are the most comfortable bed's I have ever stayed in. We stay there around once a month to gamble and I would not give it up for anything. If you play enough, you can get your room comped to you or get a discounted price. I have never paid more than $89 plus tax, and I have been given numerous free rooms. Best place to stay by far!!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hollywood Casino hotel the night we attended a concert at the Bangor Waterfront pavilion and we were impressed. The hotel is very easy to find, right off the highway. Parking is free and plentiful. The front desk staff was efficient and friendly. Rooms were very large, modern, well appointed and very clean.
reviews.title: Modern & Clean, conveniently located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to walk to and from the concert, which was fantastic. Took in a bit of gambling before and after. Dinner at the buffet was just "ok", certainly not "epic" as advertised but this isn't a review of that. The hotel was very quiet for being a casino hotel and obviously full to capacity for the concert.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Rude and Disorganized
reviews.text: I booked this hotel myself over the telephone several weeks ago in anticipation of home renovation that would leave us without water and heat. We were looking forward to turnng a tedious home reno project into something fun. When I showed up they were overbooked-and had no record of my reservations. Instead of telling me I was out of luck or just giving me a room, they told me to return home and locate my reservation number and they would then see what they could do. I trudged out of the hotel with my husband's and my huge suitcase. Once back in my car I realized that no credible hotel would tell a client to schlepp home with her suitcases to locate a reservation number. So I stayed elsewhere. I know they were overbooked and since we are not gamblers, per se, I am guessing they just didn't care if the room we expected was not available. Anyone planning on staying in this hotel should expect that the same could happen to them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009
reviews.text: I thoughly enjoyed my stay at the Hollywood Slots Hotel and Raceway in Bangor, Me. I went with group, and those who stayed at the hotel really loved our stay. The staff there went beyond their duties to make my stay there comfortable and very enjoyable. The service I received at their buffet was great, and worth the price in which I was charged. The breakfast buffet comes with the price of the room, and we were added the dinner buffet as a curtiesy. Parking there was great, as we had free parking, and was close to the enterance to the hotel, so those coming by car, was not burden by walking far to get their luggage to and from the hotel. Being this hotel was part of the Hollywood slots, that area was well taken care of and the staff was very professioal to. At the Buffet, we were given a large room off the dinning area, where we were able to sit together as a group, and the waitress/waiters were professional in their service to us. The food was great and was plenty of it. If your from out of town, state or even live in the Bangor area, I strongly recommend you going and visit the hotel or even just having dinner or breakfast in their buffet, you will glad you did.
reviews.title: Great Place to visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Have stayed at Hollywood Slots hotel 3 times & each time was very satisfying. I'm not much into the gambling, but the rooms & friendly service can't be beat for the price...
reviews.title: Very Nice & extremely clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were taking an early flight home from Bangor airport so we all decided to stay at the Hollywood Slots. It was very convienent to the airport. The buffet was excellent. We had our grown daughters with us and we all stayed in seperate rooms. The girls enjoy the music entertainment while we enjoyed playing the slots. Rooms were very clean and spacious. And it had a fabulous fitness center. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay overnight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is attached to the casino but is also a nice place to stay to see the area. We have been here a few times and are always impressed by the hotel (nice and clean) and the friendly staff. The rooms are exceptional with a flat screen TV, (a) large comfortable bed(s) and a nice bathroom with a large shower. This last time there was a wedding party at the hotel and we expected to hear noise with all of the extra people partying but we were pleasantly surprised to find a very quiet night. I think this is partly due to the well built rooms. The hotel is fairly new and because it is completely non-smoking (due to Maine state law), it seems that the "newness" is lasting. The only downside that I would say, is that it has limited activites outside of the casino. There is a nice workout room but no pool or hot tub. In the area you can go to the Maine Mall which is not very far away or to the racetrack in the summer which is across the street. When you stay at the hotel, the buffet breakfast by the casino is free and is also excellent.
reviews.title: Great deal, wonderful NON SMOKING hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is at the Hollywood Casino Bangor Maine. The casino and buffet are just steps away from your room. Also within walking distance to several bars and restaurants. There is plenty of garage parking available. The hotel is closest for anyone coming to the Bangor Waterfront Concert Series. The weekend bruch at the buffet is the best meal offered in my opinion. The brunch features a nice mixture of both breakfast and dinner items, including a cooked to order omelet station and brick oven fired pizzas.
reviews.title: Close to the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a night last week while in town to see a concert. The location is great for this as it is a 5 minute walk from the concert site. The hotel itself is quite nice, modern and I believe, relatively new. The rooms are very spacious and clean. I was surprised at how much space we had in the king bed room. Check in was a little slow and figuring out how to get into the parking garage was an ordeal lol. Access to the parkade wasn't explained by the front desk. After check in you have to exit the garage, turn left, then follow the road around to the left. The entrance is there on the left. I exited, turned right, then came around, reentered the garage from Main street only to end up back at the check in. Finally figured it out! Other than that, it is a very nice to stay and I would certainly do so again.
reviews.title: Great location for the waterfront concerts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stopped by Bangor, Maine on our way home from Halifax, NS. We'd been on the road for 8 hours and we were very tired. The American Folk Festival was in town and being held near the hotel. We fully expected it to be loud and annoying, but it definitely wasn't. In fact, it was hard to believe it was even a casino. So quiet!! The beds were comfy and the room was clean and well appointed. We were only there overnight so I can't speak to many of the services and such, but my husband did enjoy the casino for a few hours. Also, we requested a pack and play for our toddler and they brought it up and assembled it right away.The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars was because it was a little bit pricey. Still, fantastic room. I have no complaints.
reviews.title: Nice and surprisingly quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here because my regular business hotel was booked, and the price was reasonable mid week. Maybe my expectations were too high - after Foxwoods, this place seems like a wanna-be. I tried to separate my hopes to what I was actually seeing... but it still didnt do well. Hotel is not full - parking garage is almost vacant - yet they put me in a second floor room with a view of a brick wall. Signage outside was confusing, took me two rounds to manuver the parking garage. One girl at the lobby desk, no one else around. Very small lobby. Much more impressive reception at the local Hilton Garden Inn or the Marriott Courtyard. No information in the room about the casino or eating establishments. No info about amenities. No pool. Exercise room ridiculously small - 3 treadmills for a 7 floor hotel. Business center is laughable. I still dont know why this place is called a Raceway. All employees were friendly and courteous and willing to help when I asked questions....the casino was okay; mostly slot machines - not very big. SMOKE FREE which was fabulous and a first for me!! EPIC buffet was fair. Some foods not looking that appetizing but the prime rib was very good. Price was a little high for the choices available but not outrageous. Overall, I doubt I will be back.
reviews.title: really kind of anti-climatic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are in Bangor Maine and are looking for a hotel, Hollywood Slots is a good choice. This is a fairly new hotel attached to a casino. Not quite sure why they built it in Bangor,ME as there isn't much there.
reviews.title: How did this place get put in Bangor Maine???

All rooms include a complimentary full breakfast buffet and free parking in our parking garage. Amenities include 42” LCD flat screens, in-room movies, room service, fitness facility, and business center, buffet restaurant, lounge with live entertainment, and Maine’s only gaming facility featuring 1000 slot machines.
